Legal_Issue: Is the trademark 'DELI SNACK' registrable under paragraph 12(1)(b) of the Trade-marks Act?
Evidence_Assessment: The term 'DELI SNACK' is used in commerce for similar seafood-based snack products
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant (Neptune S.A.) to demonstrate registrability
Credibility_Factor: Evidence from commercial use of the term 'DELI SNACK'
Legal_Rule: A trademark is not registrable if it is clearly descriptive or deceptively misdescriptive of the character or quality of the wares
Procedural_Issue: Review of Registrar's decision by the Federal Court
Grounds_for_Claim: Trademark registration refusal based on descriptiveness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Commercial usage of 'DELI SNACK' for similar products
Applicant_Challenge: Neptune S.A. argued that 'DELI SNACK' is suggestive, not descriptive
Defendant_Response: Registrar maintained that the mark is clearly descriptive
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Clearly descriptive of the wares (seafood-based snack foods)
Applicable_Process: Administrative review followed by judicial appeal
Governing_Rule: A trademark must not be clearly descriptive of the character or quality of the goods
